answerText: Gaius Valerius Catullus [10] Many of Catullus poems are addressed to this woman, who was believed to be Clodia.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | Chicago Culture Heroes and Psychopomps | 12 | Literature | Classical | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This poet wrote many of his poems addressed to his lover's sparrow, and he briefly made enemies of Caesar with his verses about Mamurra.  [10] For ten points name this Roman poet who is well known for translating some of Sappho's works. He also wrote "Ave atque vale" about his dead brother.
